info.title: Purview Data Map Service REST API Document
info.description: Purview Data Map Service is a fully managed cloud service whose users can discover the data sources they need and understand the data sources they find. At the same time, Data Map helps organizations get more value from their existing investments. This spec defines REST API of Purview Data Map Service.

post.description:
Create or update an entity.
Existing entity is matched using its unique guid if supplied or by its unique attributes eg: qualifiedName.
Map and array of collections are not well supported. E.g., array<array<int>>, array<map<string, int>>.
For each contact type, the maximum number of contacts is 20.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: Atlas entity with extended information.

200.description: Created with EntityMutationResponse.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List entities in bulk identified by its GUIDs.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: An array of GUIDs of entities to list.

200.description: OK.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description:
Create or update entities in bulk.
Existing entity is matched using its unique guid if supplied or by its unique attributes eg: qualifiedName.
Map and array of collections are not well supported. E.g., array<array<int>>, array<map<string, int>>.
For each contact type, the maximum number of contacts is 20.

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: An array of entities to create or update.

200.description: Ok.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete a list of entities in bulk identified by their GUIDs or unique attributes.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: An array of GUIDs of entities to delete.

200.description: Deleted with EntityMutationResponse.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Associate a classification to multiple entities in bulk.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The request to associate a classification to multiple entities.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get complete definition of an entity given its GUID.

200.description: OK.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description:
Update entity partially - create or update entity attribute identified by its GUID.
Supports only primitive attribute type and entity references.
It does not support updating complex types like arrays, and maps.
Null updates are not possible.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the attribute.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The value of the attribute.

200.description: Updated with EntityMutationResponse.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete an entity identified by its GUID.

200.description: Deleted with EntityMutationResponse.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get classification for a given entity represented by a GUID.

200.description: The classification for the given entity GUID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete a given classification from an existing entity represented by a GUID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List classifications for a given entity represented by a GUID.

200.description: An array of classifications for the given entity GUID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Add classifications to an existing entity represented by a GUID.

parameters.name: classifications
parameters.description: An array of classifications to be added.

schema.description: An array of classifications.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update classifications to an existing entity represented by a guid.

parameters.name: classifications
parameters.description: An array of classifications to be updated.

schema.description: An array of classifications.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description:
Get complete definition of an entity given its type and unique attribute.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format:
attr:\<attrName>=<attrValue>.

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST request would look something like this:
GET /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

200.description: AtlasEntityWithExtInfo.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description:
Update entity partially - Allow a subset of attributes to be updated on an entity which is identified by its type and unique attribute eg: Referenceable.qualifiedName. Null updates are not possible.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format:

attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>.
NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST request would look something like this:
PUT /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: atlasEntityWithExtInfo
parameters.description: Atlas entity with extended information.

200.description: Updated with EntityMutationResponse.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description:
Delete an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.
In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format:
attr:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>.
NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST request would look something like this:
DELETE /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

200.description: Deleted with EntityMutationResponse.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete a given classification from an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Add classification to the entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: atlasClassificationArray
parameters.description: An array of classification to be added.

schema.description: An array of classification.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update classification on an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: atlasClassificationArray
parameters.description: An array of classification to be updated.

schema.description: An array of classification.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Set classifications on entities in bulk.

parameters.name: entityHeaders
parameters.description: Atlas entity headers.

200.description: OK

schema.description: Response that indicates each classification mutation result.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description:
Bulk API to retrieve list of entities identified by its unique attributes.
In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format

typeName=\<typeName>&attr_1:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>&attr_2:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>&attr_3:\<attrName>=\<attrValue>

NOTE: The attrName should be an unique attribute for the given entity-type.
The REST request would look something like this

GET /v2/entity/bulk/uniqueAttribute/type/hive_db?attr_1:qualifiedName=db1@cl1&attr_2:qualifiedName=db2@cl1

Note: at least one unique attribute must be provided.

parameters.name: attr_N:qualifiedName
parameters.description: Qualified name of an entity. E.g. to find 2 entities you can set attrs_1:qualifiedName=db1@cl1&attrs_2:qualifiedName=db2@cl1. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

200.description: OK.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description:
Delete given labels to a given entity identified by its type and unique attribute.

If labels is null/empty, no labels will be removed.

If any labels in labels set are non-existing labels, they will be ignored, only existing labels will be removed. In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format: attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>. NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName. The REST request would look something like this: DELETE /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body

schema.description: set of labels to be deleted

parameters.description: set of labels to be deleted

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description:
Set labels to a given entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

If labels is null/empty, existing labels will all be removed.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format: attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>.

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST request would look something like this: POST /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body

schema.description: set of labels to be set

parameters.description: set of labels to be set

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description:
Add given labels to a given entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

If labels is null/empty, no labels will be added.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format: attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>.

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST request would look something like this: PUT /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

parameters.name: body

schema.description: set of labels to be added

parameters.description: set of labels to be added

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: moveEntitiesRequest

200.description: Created with EntityMutationResponse.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description:
Get all glossaries. Recommend using limit/offset to get pagination result. Recommend using 'ignoreTermsAndCategories=true' and fetch terms/categories separately using 

 'GET /datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryGuid}/terms' and 

 'GET '/datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryGuid}/categories'.

200.description: An array of existing glossaries fitting the search criteria or empty list if nothing matches.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Create a glossary.

parameters.name: atlasGlossary
parameters.description:
Glossary definition, terms & categories can be anchored to a glossary.
Using the anchor attribute when creating the Term/Category.

200.description: OK. If glossary creation was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Create glossary category in bulk.

parameters.name: glossaryCategory
parameters.description: An array of glossary category definitions to be created.

schema.description: An array of glossary category definitions.

200.description: OK. If bulk glossary category creation was successful.

schema.description: An array of glossary category created successfully in bulk.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Create a glossary category.

parameters.name: glossaryCategory
parameters.description:
The glossary category definition. A category must be anchored to a Glossary when creating.
Optionally, terms belonging to the category and the hierarchy can also be defined during creation.

200.description: OK. If glossary category creation was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get specific glossary category by its GUID.

200.description: OK. If glossary category exists for given GUID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update the given glossary category by its GUID.

parameters.name: glossaryCategory
parameters.description: The glossary category to be updated.

200.description: OK. If glossary category partial update was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

204.description: OK. If glossary category deletion is successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update the glossary category partially. So far we only supports partial updating shortDescription and longDescription for category.

parameters.name: partialUpdates
parameters.description: A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute values for partial update.

schema.description: A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute values.

200.description: OK. If glossary category partial update was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get all related categories (parent and children). Limit, offset, and sort parameters are currently not being enabled and won't work even they are passed.

200.description: OK. Gets an array of related categories.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get all terms associated with the specific category.

200.description: An array of terms for the given category or an empty list.

schema.description: An array of terms for the given category or an empty list.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Create a glossary term.

parameters.name: glossaryTerm
parameters.description:
The glossary term definition. A term must be anchored to a Glossary at the time of creation.
Optionally it can be categorized as well.

200.description: OK. If glossary term creation was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a specific glossary term by its GUID.

200.description: OK. If glossary term exists for given GUID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update the given glossary term by its GUID.

parameters.name: glossaryTerm
parameters.description: The glossary term to be updated.

200.description: OK. If glossary term update was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

204.description: OK. If glossary term delete was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update the glossary term partially. So far we only supports partial updating shortDescription, longDescription, abbreviation, usage and status for term.

parameters.name: partialUpdates
parameters.description: A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute values to be updated.

schema.description: A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute values.

200.description: OK. If glossary partial update was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Create glossary terms in bulk.

parameters.name: glossaryTerm
parameters.description: An array of glossary term definitions to be created in bulk.

schema.description: An array of glossary term definitions.

200.description: OK. If bulk glossary terms creation was successful.

schema.description: If bulk glossary terms creation was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List all related objects assigned with the specified term. Recommend using limit/offset to get pagination result.

200.description: OK. An array of related objects (if any) for the given glossary or an empty list.

schema.description: An array of related objects (if any) for the given glossary or an empty list.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description:
Assign the given term to the provided list of related objects. Recommend using small batches with multiple API calls.

[Entities Create Or Update operation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/purview/datamapdataplane/entity/bulk-create-or-update?tabs=HTTP) is an alternative to assign a term to multiple entities.

parameters.name: relatedObjectIds
parameters.description: An array of related object IDs to which the term has to be associated.

schema.description: An array of related object IDs to which the term has to be associated.

204.description: OK. If the term assignment was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete the term assignment for the given list of related objects.

parameters.name: relatedObjectIds
parameters.description: An array of related object IDs from which the term has to be dissociated.

schema.description: An array of related object IDs from which the term has to be dissociated.

204.description: OK. If glossary term dissociation was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get all related terms for a specific term by its GUID. Limit, offset, and sort parameters are currently not being enabled and won't work even they are passed.

200.description: OK. An array of related glossary terms for the given glossary or an empty list.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get a specific Glossary by its GUID.

200.description: OK. If glossary with given guid exists.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: updatedGlossary
parameters.description: The glossary definition to be updated.

200.description: OK. If glossary update was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete a glossary. Will delete underlying terms/categories together. Recommend separate delete terms and categories.

204.description: OK. If glossary delete was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the categories belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using limit/offset to get pagination result.

200.description: OK. An array of glossary categories for the given glossary or an empty list.

schema.description: An array of glossary categories for the given glossary or an empty list.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the category headers belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using limit/offset to get pagination result.

200.description: OK. An array of glossary category headers for the given glossary or an empty list.

schema.description: An array of glossary category headers for the given glossary or an empty list.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description:
Get a specific glossary with detailed information. This API is not recommend.

Recommend to fetch terms/categories details separately using 

 'GET /datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryGuid}/terms' and 

 'GET '/datamap/api/atlas/v2/glossary/{glossaryGuid}/categories'.

200.description: OK. If glossary exists for given GUID.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description:
Update the glossary partially. Some properties such as qualifiedName are not allowed to be updated.

So far we only supports partial updating shortDescription, longDescription, language and usage for glossary. 

Recommend using 'ignoreTermsAndCategories=true' to reduce response body size.

parameters.name: partialUpdates
parameters.description: A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute values.

schema.description: A map containing keys as attribute names and values as corresponding attribute values.

200.description: OK. If glossary partial update was successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get terms belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using limit/offset to get pagination result.

200.description: OK. An array of glossary terms for the given glossary or an empty list.

schema.description: An array of glossary terms for the given glossary or an empty list.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get term headers belonging to a specific glossary. Recommend using limit/offset to get pagination result.

200.description: OK. An array of glossary terms for the given glossary or an empty list.

schema.description: An array of glossary terms for the given glossary or an empty list.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get lineage info of the entity specified by GUID.

200.description: OK. If the request is valid.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Return immediate next page lineage info about entity with pagination

200.description: OK. If the input is valid.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description:
Return lineage info about entity.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format

attr:[attrName]=[attrValue]

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName.

The REST request would look something like this:

GET /v2/lineage/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue.

parameters.name: attr:qualifiedName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the entity. (This is only an example. qualifiedName can be changed to other unique attributes)

schema.description: If Lineage exists for the given entity

200.description: If Lineage exists for the given entity

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: List all type definitions in bulk.

200.description: OK. AtlasTypesDef with type definitions matching the search criteria or else returns empty list of type definitions.

post.description:
Create all atlas type definitions in bulk, only new definitions will be created.
Any changes to the existing definitions will be discarded.

parameters.name: typesDef
parameters.description: A composite wrapper object with corresponding lists of the type definition.

200.description: OK. On successful update of requested type definitions.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Update all types in bulk, changes detected in the type definitions would be persisted.

parameters.name: typesDef
parameters.description: A composite object that captures all type definition changes.

200.description: OK. On successful update of requested type definitions.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete API for all types in bulk.

parameters.name: typesDef
parameters.description: A composite object that captures all types to be deleted

204.description: OK. On successful deletion of the requested type definitions.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

An array of AtlasTypeDefHeader matching the search criteria
or an empty list if no match.

AtlasAttributeDef.title: AtlasAttributeDef
AtlasAttributeDef.description: class that captures details of a struct-attribute.

createTime.description: The created time of the record.

createdBy.description: The user who created the record.

description.description: The description of the type definition.

guid.description: The GUID of the type definition.

name.description: The name of the type definition.

options.description: The options for the type definition.

updateTime.description: The update time of the record.

AtlasClassification.title: AtlasClassification

removePropagationsOnEntityDelete.description: Determines if propagations will be removed on entity deletion.

validityPeriods.description: An array of time boundaries indicating validity periods.

AtlasClassification.description: An instance of a classification; it doesn't have an identity, this object exists only when associated with an entity.

AtlasClassificationDef.title: AtlasClassificationDef

entityTypes.description:
Specifying a list of entityType names in the classificationDef, ensures that classifications can only be applied to those entityTypes.
  • Any subtypes of the entity types inherit the restriction
  • Any classificationDef subtypes inherit the parents entityTypes restrictions
  • Any classificationDef subtypes can further restrict the parents entityTypes restrictions by specifying a subset of the entityTypes
  • An empty entityTypes list when there are no parent restrictions means there are no restrictions
  • An empty entityTypes list when there are parent restrictions means that the subtype picks up the parents restrictions
  • If a list of entityTypes are supplied, where one inherits from another, this will be rejected. This should encourage cleaner classificationsDefs

AtlasClassificationDef.description: class that captures details of a classification-type.

params.description: The parameters of the constraint definition.

AtlasRelationshipDef.title: AtlasRelationshipDef
AtlasRelationshipDef.description:
AtlasRelationshipDef is a TypeDef that defines a relationship.

As with other typeDefs the AtlasRelationshipDef has a name. Once created the RelationshipDef has a guid. The name and the guid are the 2 ways that the RelationshipDef is identified.

RelationshipDefs have 2 ends, each of which specify cardinality, an EntityDef type name and name and optionally whether the end is a container.

RelationshipDefs can have AttributeDefs - though only primitive types are allowed.
RelationshipDefs have a relationshipCategory specifying the UML type of relationship required
The way EntityDefs and RelationshipDefs are intended to be used is that EntityDefs will define AttributeDefs these AttributeDefs will not specify an EntityDef type name as their types.

RelationshipDefs introduce new attributes to the entity instances. For example

EntityDef A might have attributes attr1,attr2,attr3
EntityDef B might have attributes attr4,attr5,attr6
RelationshipDef AtoB might define 2 ends 

   end1:  type A, name attr7
   end2:  type B, name attr8

When an instance of EntityDef A is created, it will have attributes attr1,attr2,attr3,attr7
When an instance of EntityDef B is created, it will have attributes attr4,attr5,attr6,attr8

In this way relationshipDefs can be authored separately from entityDefs and can inject relationship attributes into the entity instances

description.description: The description of the relationship end definition.

isLegacyAttribute.description: Determines if it is a legacy attribute.

name.description: The name of the relationship end definition.

type.description: The type of the relationship end.

AtlasRelationshipEndDef.title: AtlasRelationshipEndDef
AtlasRelationshipEndDef.description:
The relationshipEndDef represents an end of the relationship. The end of the relationship is defined by a type, an
attribute name, cardinality and whether it  is the container end of the relationship.

isLegacyAttribute.description: Determines if it is a legacy attribute.

relationshipTypeName.description: The name of the relationship type.

AtlasRelationshipAttributeDef.title: AtlasRelationshipEndDef
AtlasRelationshipAttributeDef.description:
The relationshipEndDef represents an end of the relationship. The end of the relationship is defined by a type, an
attribute name, cardinality and whether it  is the container end of the relationship.

  • Any subtypes of the entity types inherit the restriction

  • Any classificationDef subtypes can further restrict the parents entityTypes restrictions by specifying a subset of the entityTypes
  • An empty entityTypes list when there are no parent restrictions means there are no restrictions

RelationshipCategory.title: RelationshipCategory
RelationshipCategory.description:
The Relationship category determines the style of relationship around containment and lifecycle. UML terminology is used for the values.

ASSOCIATION is a relationship with no containment.
COMPOSITION and AGGREGATION are containment relationships.

The difference being in the lifecycles of the container and its children. In the COMPOSITION case, the children cannot exist without the container. For AGGREGATION, the life cycles of the container and children are totally independent.

keywords.description: The keywords applied to all fields that support autocomplete operation. It must be at least 1 character, and no more than 100 characters.
